title: Two Morning Glories
description: Imperial Fei-ts\'ui jade carving in the form of Two Morning Glories resting on openly carved branches surrounded by leaves. A dragonfly and a butterfly are also carved in deep relief on the flower. The carving is brilliantly p[olished. The butterfly is the emblem of conjugal felicity - in fact it might almost be called the \'Chinese Cupid\'. Carved wood base.
creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Augustus L. Searle
